definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
to take care of a matter all by oneself/to run the whole show

sentences.english: Previously, companies dictated what software and hardware were used for work purposes.
sentences.chinese: 以往，公司就能一手包办定下工作所需软硬件的功能。

sentences.english: Her bag is stuffed with McDonald's coupons and other discount cards.
sentences.chinese: 她的手包里有麦当劳的优惠券和其他各种打折卡。

sentences.english: Yves Saint Laurent clutch in metallic leather is the height of luxury。
sentences.chinese: 伊夫圣罗兰设计的金属皮革手包是奢华的象征。

sentences.english: After you dressed the cut hand of your own baby woodcutter.
sentences.chinese: 在你把小儿被柴刀砍伤了的手包好之后。
我要用绷带把您的手包起来。

sentences.english: It is that tall man who wrenched the handbag from the old woman last night.
sentences.chinese: 就是那个高个子的男人昨晚抢走了老妇人的手包。

sentences.english: I found my purse and headed for the door.
sentences.chinese: 我找到我的手包，朝门走去。

sentences.english: Fiona answered, and she put her bag on another chair.
sentences.chinese: 菲欧娜答道，把她的手包放在另一张椅子上。

sentences.english: Then the little red hen had to do everything herself.
sentences.chinese: 然后小红母鸡就自己一手包办所有事。

sentences.english: Wedding preparation formed by the fusion of flat, can counteract managed manually Yang flower of course back to participate.
sentences.chinese: 婚礼筹备由羽平一手包办，可中和杨朵当然回来参与。

definition: bag or purse etc/small bump or pimple/hillock
